modules.description: Provides monadic operations for sequencing I/O actions, including binding results between computations and lifting values into the I/O context. Works with input and output channels, as well as file descriptors, to handle reading from and writing to streams. Enables reading lines, buffering input, and ensuring data is fully written or flushed, such as when processing network data or file content.

Provides functions to construct and send HTTP requests with methods like GET, POST, PUT, and DELETE, and to process corresponding responses, including handling headers, body content, and chunked encoding. Operates with types such as HTTP methods, URIs, headers, and body content from Cohttp. Enables direct interaction with HTTP endpoints by returning response objects and their associated bodies for immediate consumption.

Handles I/O operations through monadic sequencing, enabling safe and structured processing of input and output streams. Supports reading lines, buffering, and flushing data, with operations on channels and file descriptors. Allows for composing complex I/O workflows by binding results and lifting values into an I/O context. Example tasks include reading HTTP request bodies, writing response headers, and managing stream lifecycles.

Handles HTTP request routing and response generation using Cohttp with Picos_io for I/O operations. Processes HTTP messages, parses headers, and manages connection lifecycles. Used to build lightweight HTTP servers that respond to GET and POST requests with custom logic.

provides HTTP request construction and response handling with support for standard methods and content processing, along with I/O operations using monadic workflows for stream management. It works with HTTP methods, URIs, headers, and body content, and includes functions for reading, writing, and managing data streams. Users can send GET, POST, PUT, or DELETE requests, process responses, and handle streaming data through channels and file descriptors. Examples include parsing HTTP bodies, writing headers, and managing chunked transfers in a structured, composable way.
